🌵 Streams in the Desert - April 9 🌞

"All these things are against me" (Genesis 42:36) ✝️
"All things work together for good to them that love God" (Romans 8:28) 🙏

Many people want power. But how do we get power? ⚡ The other day we saw a power plant where electric trains get their energy. We heard the loud noise of many wheels turning. We asked, "How does this make power?" 🔌

Our friend explained: "The wheels rubbing together create electricity. The friction makes the power." 🔥

It's the same with God. When He wants to give you more spiritual power, He allows pressure in your life. 💪 The hard times create spiritual strength through friction. Some people try to run from problems instead of using them to grow stronger. 🏃‍♂️

Challenges are necessary for balance. 🌎 The Earth stays in orbit because two forces work against each other - one pushing forward, one holding back. Without this balance, our planet would fly off into empty space. 🚀

God guides our lives the same way. We need both pushing and holding back forces. He uses life's tests, temptations, and things that seem against us to actually move us forward on the right path. 🛤️

Let's thank God for both the easy and hard times. Let's accept the weights along with the wings. With God's help, let's keep going forward with faith and patience toward our heavenly calling. ✨

--A. B. Simpson 📖

In a factory, many machines work together:
⚙️ Wheels turn fast and slow
🔧 Some push while others pull
🔊 Some are loud, some are quiet
🤹 It looks like chaos, but everything has a purpose
👨‍🔧 From the biggest lever to the smallest part
🤲 All work together as planned
🧠 A wise mind controls it all
✋ A strong hand guides everything

This is how God works for His people:
🌪️ Some things might seem bad alone
🛑 Some might appear to block us
↩️ Some might seem to pull us back
🤝 But together, they work for good
😔 Our disappointments
❌ Our unmet desires
❓ Things we don't understand
✋ Are all held in our Father's loving hand

--Annie Johnson Flint ✍️
